Member Data Documentation

UString::Encoding chaos::str::UString::defaultInputEncoding = UString::ENCODING_UTF8
static

The default encoding that input data will be provided in. This value is initially set to ENCODING_UTF8 on Unix systems and ENCODING_UTF16 on Windows systems.

For example if this value is set to ENCODING_UTF8, creating a UString with:

chaos::str::UString( "Ἦλθον, εἶδον, ἐνίκησα" );

will assume the provided char array data is encoded with utf-8

UString::DataWidth chaos::str::UString::defaultInputWidth = UString::DATAWIDTH_8
static

The default bit width of each character that input data will be provided in. This value is initially set to DATAWIDTH_8.

For example if this value was set to DATAWIDTH_8, creating a UString with:

chaos::str::UString( "Ἦλθον, εἶδον, ἐνίκησα" );

would correctly read that data. Even though most of the characters are stored across two 8-bit chars: the data is represented in an array of 8-bit chars.

Whereas creating a UString with:

chaos::str::UString( u"Ἦλθον, εἶδον, ἐνίκησα" );

would cause problems since the data is nor represented with an array of 16-bit wide chars. To solve this you would need to either explicitly pass the data width to the constructor through a DataDefinition struct, or change this default value.
